708.question: What are the linguistic differences between each class?
708.response: {'Answer': "The Hyperbole class uses more verbs such as 'I bet,' 'you don't see,' 'everyone knows,' and 'I wonder,' as well as adverb-adjective cues such as 'no way,' 'so much,' 'oh dear,' 'how much,' and 'exactly what.' The Rhetorical Question class uses verbs such as 'realize,' 'recognize,' 'not read,' 'get,' and 'have' as well as adjectives such as 'dummy' and 'problem.' The Generic class uses more adverb-noun and adjective-noun patterns, such as 'Adv Noun' (once again), 'Adj Noun' (second amendment), and 'Adj Noun' (number of)."}
708.answer: Each class has different patterns in adjectives, adverbs and verbs for sarcastic and non-sarcastic classes
